Yes, let's make a server that only a small percentage of the playerbase can play on that's riddled with poor MS, disconnects, and other connection issues as a basis for balancing champions!

Please. It's the worst idea I've heard. The only time PBE balance is taken into account is if something is game breaking to the point of insanity - otherwise, it's just about bugs. That's how Graves got released the way he was - he had no game breaking bugs, and most of his problems can be fixed with numbers. So they give him to the MUCH, MUCH larger playerbase on live before touching his numbers. I think it would be ignorant of Riot to utilize the PBE for balance - there's just not enough games played and not enough people playing on the server, in addition to there being other problems as I mentioned above.

Let's take a hypothetical situation. They upgrade PBE so it's technically just a good as live. They also open PBE acess to everyone. It just so happens that because people like content, more and more people start playing on the PBE instead of live, to the point where there are more people on PBE than live.

At this point, what's the point of even having PBE and live seperate anymore? The majority of the community is going to have to experience the bad balance, bugs, etc on the PBE anyway. It'd be like if all the sudden Riot decided to make current PBE one patch behind live. That would be ridiculous, because the point of the PBE is to shield the majority of the playerbase from bugs and other bad/unfinished experiences.
